textbooks: Principles of Macroeconomics 1st Canadian Edition (2023) by Milligan, Oreopoulos, Stevenson and Wolfers
otherInfo: All assessments are subject to change. Changes will be posted to the EC140 MyLearningSpace page.
Lectures will be live-streamed and recorded on Zoom, but this is not guaranteed. Tutorials will be scheduled occasionally on Zoom and recorded.
Only the best 12 minor assessment grades (out of at least 15) in each of the four parts of the course count towards your overall grade. Late submissions will not be accepted.

Students who miss a midterm for religious observance, academic conflict, or varsity athletics may write an alternate test. Notification must be given early. Other missed midterms will have the weight shifted to the final exam.  A Missed Midterm “Quiz” should be completed to explain the absence.
Students who miss the final exam for an acceptable reason may apply for a deferred exam.
Class and tutorial sessions may be recorded. By attending, you consent to the collection of this information. Contact the instructor if concerned about personal information.
Recording lectures is prohibited unless permission is granted.  This is to protect intellectual property.  Unauthorized posting of course materials violates copyright.

courses.name: Not specified
otherInfo: Participation is worth 10% and includes attendance, engagement, and group contributions.  Students should bring a non-programmable calculator and cheat sheet to Midterm 1.  The Group Project (12%) is a group assignment with evaluation based on functionality, creativity, and teamwork.
